humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a tumor size of 28 mm, which is equivalent to 2.8 cm. This is larger than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, which corresponds to a T2 stage according to the rules provided. The presence of DCIS does not affect the T stage for invasive carcinoma, so the T stage is still T2. The tumor size is explicitly provided in the report, so there is no need to use any other rules to determine the T stage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the tumor size is 28 mm, which falls within the T2 category for T stage in breast cancer. T2 stage is defined as a tumor size between 20-50 mm. Therefore, the T stage from this report is T2.
